CHAPTER II

THE NECESSITY FOR THIS IDEAL

A CAREFUL consideration of the forces within the Church which commonly make for unrighteousness will show how natural and necessary are those aspects of the ideal of Jesus just enumerated. (a) The greatest of these evil forces is undoubtedly the attitude of the saints towards sinners. If we go into any mixed company, the people who charm us, be we who we may, are seldom those remarkable for their piety3 but if the pious man does not make himself agree- able to the secular man, this is no proof
